steps.task: In this exercise, you will learn how to dockerize a web application. You will use nginx server to serve static html website.
Clone the repository from given link. This repository contains static files for the web application.
Create 'nginx.conf' file in the root directory of the repository. This file will contain configuration for nginx server.
Copy configuration and paste it in 'nginx.conf' file. This configuration will be used by nginx server to serve your webapp.
Create 'supervisord.conf' file in the root directory. This file will contain configuration for supervisord process manager.
Copy configuration and paste it in the 'supervisord.conf' file. This configuration will be used by the supervisord process manager to run nginx server.
Create 'Dockerfile' in the root directory. This file will contain instructions to build docker image for web application.
Add the following content to the Dockerfile created in previous step.
Build the docker image using the Dockerfile. Run this command in the root directory of the repository.
Run a docker container using the built image. This command will start the web application container and map port 8080 of the container to port 8080 of the host machine.
Open your web browser and navigate to http://localhost:8080 to view the web application.
You have successfully dockerized a web application using nginx server.
